result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not be at Rick's Olde Gold.
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shop or secondhand dealer that purchases items from the public. 
- Defendant shall not be at any music store. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

03:02 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Defense moved to dismiss Complaint, made argument. Objection and argument by State. Rebuttal by defense. Court denied motion. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. NOTE: This case appears to be a reissue from 22CM899.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
